questions.stem: When can access to legal advice be delayed under Annex B of Code C?

options.text: For any offence
Only for indictable offences, in specific circumstances, and with proper authorisation
For summary-only offences
Always, if the police request it

questions.explanation: Delay of legal advice under Annex B is only permitted for indictable offences, in specific circumstances (e.g., risk of alerting accomplices, interference with evidence), and requires proper authorisation from a superintendent or above. Delay is not permitted for summary-only offences.

references.cite: PACE 1984 s.58 (delay conditions)
Code C Annex B (delay of legal advice)

questions.stem: What rank of officer can authorise delay of legal advice under Annex B?

options.text: Any police officer
A superintendent or above
A sergeant
The custody officer

questions.explanation: Delay of legal advice under Annex B requires authorisation from a superintendent or above. This is a high-level decision that cannot be made by lower-ranking officers. The authorisation must be properly recorded and the reasons documented.

references.cite: Code C Annex B (delay of legal advice)
PACE 1984 s.58 (delay conditions)

questions.stem: A client's access to legal advice has been delayed. You discover the delay was not properly authorised or the circumstances did not justify it. What should you do?

options.text: Do nothingâ€”the delay has already happened
Challenge the delay immediately, record your objections, and consider challenging any evidence obtained during the delay period under s.78 PACE
Only challenge if the client is charged
Accept the delay as valid

questions.explanation: If a delay of legal advice is improper (not properly authorised or not justified by the circumstances), you must challenge it immediately, record your objections, and consider challenging any evidence obtained during the delay period under s.78 PACE. Improper delay can render evidence unfair and lead to exclusion.

references.cite: Code C Annex B (delay of legal advice)
PACE 1984 s.78 (exclusion of unfair evidence)
